item.name: Railroads, Pipelines, and Hazardous Materials Subcommittee

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

item.name: Railroads, Pipelines, and Hazardous Materials Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Railroads, Pipelines, and Hazardous Materials.
Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

summary.text:
Safe Freight Act of 2019

This bill prohibits the operation of a freight train or light locomotive engine used in the movement of freight unless it has a crew of at least two individuals, one of whom is certified by the Federal Railroad Administration as a locomotive operator and the other as a train conductor.

bill.title: Safe Freight Act of 2019

item.title: To amend title 49, United States Code, to provide for the minimum size of crews of freight trains, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Railroads, Pipelines, and Hazardous Materials.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
